title: PressyCube: An Embeddable Pressure Sensor with Softy Prop for Limb Rehabilitation in Immersive Virtual Reality
venue: 2022 IEEE International Conference on Multimedia and Expo Workshops (ICMEW ‘22)
excerpt: This paper is about PressyCube, an embeddable pressure sensor collecting physical force data from different types of exercises for home-based rehabilitation
citation: Chu, C. Y., Ng, H. Y., Lin, C. H., & Han, P. H. (2022, July). "PressyCube: An Embeddable Pressure Sensor with Softy Prop for Limb Rehabilitation in Immersive Virtual Reality." 2022 IEEE International Conference on Multimedia and Expo Workshops (ICMEW). (pp. 1-1). IEEE.

title: Movablebag: Exploring Asymmetric Interaction for Multi-user Exergame in Extended Reality.
venue: Adjunct Proceedings of the 2022 ACM International Joint Conference on Pervasive and Ubiquitous Computing and the 2022 ACM International Symposium on Wearable Computers (UbiComp/ISWC 2022 Adjunct: MIMSVAI ‘’22)
excerpt: This paper is about MovableBag, a robot that can be adapted to multi-user exergames with props and as an interactive agent for physical interaction with user
citation: Mendez, L. A., Ng, H. Y., & Han, P. H. (2022, September). MovableBag: Exploring Asymmetric Interaction for Multi-user Exergame in Extended Reality. In Adjunct Proceedings of the 2022 ACM International Joint Conference on Pervasive and Ubiquitous Computing and the 2022 ACM International Symposium on Wearable Computers (UbiComp/ISWC 2022 Adjunct: MIMSVAI ‘’22) (pp. 515-519).

title: MovableBag: Substitutional robot for enhancing immersive boxing training with encountered-type haptic
excerpt: This paper is about MovableBag, a substitutional robot that provides room-scale mobility and the ability to carry sport props with an easier tracking setup to simulate the boxing opponent or coach in virtual reality with encountered-type haptic feedback
citation: Mendez S, L. A., Ng, H. Y., Lim, Z. Y., Lu, Y. J., & Han, P. H. (2022). MovableBag: Substitutional robot for enhancing immersive boxing training with encountered-type haptic. In SIGGRAPH Asia 2022 XR (pp. 1-2).

title: PressySofties: Utilize Conductive-Cloth Cube to Explore Squeeze Interaction Among Multi-Users.
venue: The 8th Annual Conference of Taiwanese Association of Computer-Human Interaction (TAICHI ‘22)
citation: <ins>Ho Yin Ng</ins>, Chia-Hui Lin, Zin Yin Lim, Yi-Jie Lu, Chi-Yu Lin, Ping-Hsuan Han. PressySofties: Utilize Conductive-Cloth Cube to Explore Squeeze Interaction Among Multi-Users. The 8th Annual Conference of Taiwanese Association of Computer-Human Interaction (TAICHI ‘22), Demos.

title: MovableBag: Integrating Haptics and Visual Feedback on Mobile Devices to Enhance the Virtual Reality Experience of Sport Training.

title: PressySofties: Explore multi-player squeeze interaction with conductive fabric cubes
venue: Adjunct Proceedings of the 2022 ACM International Joint Conference on Pervasive and Ubiquitous Computing and the 2022 ACM International Symposium on Wearable Computers (UbiComp/ISWC 2022 Adjunct: MIMSVAI ‘’22)

title: What Color Scheme is More Effective in Assisting Readers to Locate Information in a Color-Coded Article?
citation: <ins>Ho Yin Ng</ins>, Zeyu He, and Ting-Hao ‘Kenneth’ Huang. "What Color Scheme is More Effective in Assisting Readers to Locate Information in a Color-Coded Article?." 2024 IEEE Visualization and Visual Analytics (VIS). IEEE, 2024.
